name: places/ChIJc6GIBIZYwokRpU5ni4Q4Yuk
formattedAddress: 300 E 76th St, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: 300 E 76th St, New York, NY 10021, USA

originalText.text:
I can't praise the Stumble Inn enough for making my daughter's first birthday party an absolute hit! From the initial planning stages to the very end of the celebration, they were incredibly accommodating and helpful, ensuring that every detail was just perfect.

The planning process was a breeze, all thanks to the helpful and friendly staff at the Stumble Inn. They listened to our ideas, offered valuable suggestions, and executed everything flawlessly. Their attention to detail and willingness to go the extra mile truly made the event stress-free and enjoyable.

The rave reviews from our guests about the chicken fingers were endless. In fact, many said they were the best they've ever had! The menu was diverse and catered to all tastes, and the quality of the food was outstanding. It's not easy to please a crowd of various ages and preferences, but the Stumble Inn managed to do it effortlessly.

The ambiance of the venue added to the overall positive experience. It was warm, inviting, and perfectly set up for a celebration. The staff was attentive, ensuring that everyone's needs were met promptly and with a smile.

I genuinely appreciate the Stumble Inn for their exceptional service, delicious food, and the fantastic atmosphere they provided for my daughter's special day. Thanks to their dedication and hard work, our guests and, most importantly, the birthday girl, had an unforgettable time. If you're looking for a venue that combines excellent customer service with mouthwatering food and a great atmosphere, look no further than the Stumble Inn. I wholeheartedly recommend them and am incredibly grateful for the wonderful memories they helped create for our family. Thank you, Stumble Inn, for making our daughter's first birthday celebration truly memorable!

originalText.text:
Okay, so I booked my brother's bachelor party with the girls of Eat Drink and be Merry and let me tell you how wonderful and accommodating they were and the services they provide. I can't remember all of the names but I believe there was a Brittany, Christine and I want to say Kate.

Our first part of the night we started off at the Gin Mill for dinner.  I got to be honest the food was a lot better than what I thought it was going to be.  Pasta, Chicken, Steak, potatoes, tator tots, all delicious.  Maggie, who was I guess the host of the party was excellent along with our bartender.  I cannot remember her name but she was blonde (sorry) and very on top of whatever drinks we needed. I rate everything at this place a 10

Our limo driver Steve who was flat out the man...enough said!!!!! He catered to us as best as he could and went above and beyond. I would definitely have him as a limo driver again.

originalText.text: Great place for a party. Great staff and great food. Had my son's first bday party at East Wing and it was great for the kids and the adults.
